This helped me.
Consume per 20 ms. I think this is a problem. if 20ms have a lot of data into DataCarrier . datacarrier will be discarded data . datacarrier buffer strategy is `BufferStrategy.IF_POSSIBLE`. 
How improve？
How many traces do you intend to add into the buffer in 20ms cycle? I am confusing.
you are right .I mistakenly thought it was 20s

Use Kibana to search who's log? SkyWalking or Logstash?

>           Use Kibana to search who's log? SkyWalking or Logstash?

SkyWalking . I want more convenient query logs from SkyWalking . So I want to use Kibana to query logs from SkyWalking.

@IcebergXTY Thanks for the feedback. I already dropped an request in Dubbo mail list, https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/ed79a0284fddfedc53c96e5666a059617693cd4d7628c32de2935ea4@%3Cdev.dubbo.apache.org%3E . Let's wait and see what are they going to response, and we could work from here.
@chickenlj I've checked the git commit log, this change is from you. Could u pls. take some time to look at it?

Sure, I am here on it.

I guess the newly added method `setSkyWalkingDynamicField(Object)` from SkyWalking is not expected to be automatically injected by Dubbo framework. To make Dubbo more adaptable, I think we  should do the following:
1. A method level annotation to enable auto-injection or not.
2. Special handling for generic Object parameter type.
@IcebergXTY @wu-sheng Do you think this will solve your problem?
hello, skywalking 5.0.0-GA version can support shardingjdbc storage ? have related docs ? thank you for you answer.
SkyWalking provided querys based on GraphQL. Try that.

> > A method level annotation to enable auto-injection or not.
> 
> @chickenlj I hope the default is not :) SkyWalking will add this method to all enhanced classes, we can't add an annotation belongs to Dubbo only, may trigger ClassNotFound in other scenarios.

Set the default value to not would bring lots of changes to Dubbo, many methods would need to add an annotation and enable injection. Can't SkyWalking just add an annotation when instrumenting Dubbo? 
Anyway, I think Dubbo need an annotation to flexibly control the injection action.

> Or, when could not find the inject way, just ignore. The auto set should not be active always from my perspective.

Sounds reasonable, I will consider the possibility of ignoring it when fails.
@chickenlj  What is The parameter `instance` about `injectExtension` method, an `MonitorFilter` object?

> Set the default value to not would bring lots of changes to Dubbo, many methods would need to add an annotation and enable injection. Can't SkyWalking just add an annotation when instrumenting Dubbo?
Anyway, I think Dubbo need an annotation to flexibly control the injection action.

In theory, we can. But we haven't that kind of core API to do so.  So, I hope Dubbo can ignore that by the default mechanism. @chickenlj @diecui1202 Hope this could be fixed soon, and I will keep this open to track the status. If you have any solution, please leave the message here.

What do you mean seaching page? I am not following. GraphQL query protocols are here, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/tree/5.x/apm-protocol/apm-ui-protocol/src/main/resources/ui-graphql
no, i am not sure. you can run test by now.
A year of hard work has not been wasted, I can't wait to see SkyWalking become part of the Apache's TLP project. Thanks to all the PPMC members, Committers and our users.
We found the solution. The issue was caused by repackaging of `spring-boot-maven-plugin` . Replacing this plugin with `maven-jar-plugin` fixed this issue.

I have created a patch to fix this problem, briefly changes:
* Add optional Inject annotation for developers to decide open auto-injection or not.
* Printing log instead of throwing Exception in SpringExtensionFactory when multi-extension or no extension found.

Both of these are great. Especially just log rather than throw exception. :) Thank so much for helping. @chickenlj .

FYI @3zamn @IcebergXTY @ascrutae  I think we just need to wait for new version of Dubbo. @chickenlj please info us after release done, then we can close this issue officially.

I don't know why actually. My guess, you are generating classes and put them in a Map.  Could you check why the exception happens from your JRE source codes?

> java.lang.ClassCircularityError: java/util/LinkedHashMap$LinkedKeyIterator
at java.util.LinkedHashMap$LinkedKeySet.iterator(LinkedHashMap.java:543)
at java.io.ExpiringCache.cleanup(ExpiringCache.java:119)
I met the same issue with Sharding JDBC storage.
SkyWalking doesn't enhance class in the cycle. It is invoked once when the first class load happens.

Ping @terrymanu @tristaZero @tuohai666

I just ping the Sharding-Sphere committers, hope they could provide helps. As I said, the codes for this storage solution, it may not be ready.

we dont do anything, except add -javaagent:xxxx/skywalking-agent.jar arguments in the spribgboot 
 startup.sh script.
it happens too
I don't mean you are doing anything to SkyWalking, I mean something happens in your codes which conflict somehow.
any error log about sharding-jdbc? Maybe I can find some hints.
we add a zk clinet listerner which deal with the call back method , then it happens

ProtectiveShieldMatcher is a fail-safe mechanism, this log would harm anything, just warning. But if repeat again and again, it means many codes have conflicts. Also `ClassCircularityError` is hard to see why, need your help what classes do you put into the map.

> any error log about sharding-jdbc? Maybe I can find some hints.

I doubt these is sharding jdbc 's bug. This most likely because the sharding jdbc storage implementor can't work.
ok, I will have a look

@chidaodezhongsheng Your PR target is incorrect. Please send to 5.x branch.
Your PR target is incorrect. Please send to 5.x branch. And please test on the codebases. Clearly, this code can't run.
English only.

> Caused by: javax.ws.rs.ProcessingException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The attachments of RpcContext must not contain ',' or '=' when using rest protocol

Do you have URL including `,` or `=`? SkyWalking injected header likes this, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/5.x/docs/en/Skywalking-Cross-Process-Propagation-Headers-Protocol-v1.md#sample-value . No `,` or `=`. But we put un-encoded url into the header.

That is also why SkyWalking 6-beta is going to upgrade the header protocol to v2 in this PR, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1767/files . The new protocol is here, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/1263e3d8efb633afb39ec3928911a23ab6068b4a/docs/en/protocols/Skywalking-Cross-Process-Propagation-Headers-Protocol-v2.md
If you want to take part in, I am welcome to work with you about this document PR and new header.
@wu-sheng That's great!Thank you for your work! 😊
@IcebergXTY The credits belong to Dubbo team. @chickenlj
No, we don't have that.  Why do we need that?
